benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search - Search custom fields by type, name and optional value

covered: Valid Request: Extensive positive-path searches across objectType, fieldName, fieldValue, and their combinations (TC01–TC06, TC27, TC37).
Empty Response: Explicit empty results for no matches and empty DB states (TC11, TC22, TC28).
Pagination: Basic and edge behaviors tested (limit/offset usage, large offset, large limit) (TC07, TC21, TC22).
Query Parameters: Broad mix of valid/invalid inputs, extra params ignored; enum handling for audit; SQLi/XSS input validation (TC02–TC06, TC08–TC12, TC13–TC16, TC19, TC20).
Error Handling: Invalid parameter values produce 4xx; dependency outage yields 503 (TC13–TC16, TC18).
Audit Levels: FULL/MINIMAL/NONE behavior and integration verification (TC08–TC10, TC26, TC32, TC33).
Performance/Load/Concurrency: Concurrent requests, heavy load, response-time SLAs under various loads (TC23–TC24, TC30–TC31, TC33).
Regression Coverage: Known prior defects for fieldName filtering and audit=FULL (TC25–TC26).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios validating throttling/429 behavior for burst traffic; concurrent tests do not assert rate-limit semantics.
Caching Behavior: No checks for Content-Type correctness and caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).

Pagination Defaults and Ordering: No test asserting default limit=100 and offset=0 when omitted; TC01 expects “all” which may contradict default limit. No deterministic sort order verification across pages.
Invalid Data Types: No tests for non-integer offset/limit (e.g., offset=abc), overly large integers, or non-string types for string params.
Authorization Depth: No 403/role-based access control scenario when authenticated but not authorized (if applicable).
Input Edge Cases: No tests for empty/blank fieldName/fieldValue, leading/trailing spaces, Unicode/locale cases, or case sensitivity of objectType enum.
URL Encoding: No scenarios ensuring proper handling of URL-encoded special characters in fieldName/fieldValue.
Response Schema/Headers: Only partial schema checks; no verification of error response schema structure across all 4xx/5xx; no verification of produces: application/json via Content-Type header.
Resilience/Server Errors: No simulation of internal server error (500) unrelated to audit service (e.g., DB failure) and expected error contract.
recommendations: Add rate limiting tests: send burst requests to trigger/verify 429, Retry-After header, and ensure graceful degradation.
Add caching tests: assert Content-Type: application/json; presence/format of Cache-Control and ETag; exercise conditional GET with If-None-Match to expect 304 when appropriate.
Clarify and test pagination defaults: verify default limit=100 and offset=0 when omitted; add tests for stable, documented sort order and page-to-page consistency.
Expand validation tests: non-integer offset/limit, extremely large numeric values, and type mismatches for all params.
Authorization breadth: if the API enforces RBAC, add a 403 test for authenticated but unauthorized users.
Edge-case inputs: add blank/whitespace-only, Unicode (e.g., accented, CJK), and case sensitivity tests for objectType, fieldName, fieldValue; verify trimming/normalization rules.
URL encoding coverage: test percent-encoded values for fieldName/fieldValue to ensure server decodes safely and consistently.

Strengthen schema assertions: validate full CustomField schema including required/optional fields and audit sub-objects; verify a consistent error schema (code, message, details) for all failure modes.
Introduce generic 500-resilience scenario (e.g., DB failure) to verify error handling, logging correlation IDs, and non-leakage of stack traces.
